result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:36 PM Defendant Corey L Schoenrock in court.  Attorney Adam Raabe in court for Corey L Schoenrock.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Adam Raabe appointed
Initial Appearance set for August 15, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 1

S22-07334
sent to DHS/MMHI & WFU/BC on 10/12/22 sp

Take all medications as prescribed 
Do not participate or be on any social media ie twitter, snapchat, FB etc

11:34 AM Defendant Corey L Schoenrock appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of WI.  Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of terrorist threats.
Court makes the parties aware that she may have represented him on past dates but he is not sure.
If Court needs to recuse she will do that at a later date.
Court had represented the brother of Corey as per the mother of Corey who is in the courtroom.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $10,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule objects to the cash bond and states her reasons on the record.
Both parties agree that he has prior convictions.
Court will set a $7,500 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
